settings.text: View our most frequently asked questions about the PetSnowy

settings.h3: Where should I place SNOW+ during installation?
settings.text: It is recommended to place SNOW+ near the cat's original litter box to aid in the cat's adaptation. Ensure it is placed on a flat, stable surface near a power outlet, avoiding soft or uneven surfaces. Leave at least 2 inches of space around the device for the safety sensor and avoid placing it against a wall. Do not place the device outdoors or in high heat or humid areas.

settings.h3: What type of litter should I use with SNOW+?
settings.text: It is recommended to use high-quality clay clumping litter. Avoid using highly absorbent, non-clumping, loosely clumping, or pellet-based litters made of newspaper or wood. If using small beads or crystals, ensure they can pass through the filter and consider mixing them with clay litter in a 7/3 ratio. When initially introducing SNOW+ to your cat, it is best to use the same brand or type of litter they were previously using.

settings.h3: How should I add litter to SNOW+?
settings.text:
Lift the cover and pour clumping litter into the litter bed from the
opening. Be cautious not to exceed the "maximum fill line" indicated on the device. The litter bed can hold a maximum of 5.7 pounds (2.6 kg) of litter. If using mineral sand, it can hold a maximum of 5 kg. Spread the litter evenly once it is inside the litter bed. If you accidentally add too much litter, remove the excess to prevent it from falling into the drawer during cleaning.

settings.h3: Can I use a litter mat or carpet with SNOW+?
settings.text: Yes, you can use a litter mat or carpet with SNOW+. Ensure that it covers the entire bottom of the device and keeps all four legs stable to maintain stability and prevent slipping.

settings.h3: Can I place SNOW+ against a wall?
settings.text: No, it is recommended to avoid placing SNOW+ against a wall. Leave at least 2 inches of space around the device to ensure the proper functioning of the safety sensor.

settings.h3: Can I place SNOW+ outdoors or in high heat or humid areas?
settings.text: No, SNOW+ should not be placed outdoors or in high heat or humid areas. It is designed for indoor use only.

settings.h2: Introducing Your Cat to the Litter Box

settings.h3: Should I leave the top open or remove the bonnet when introducing my cat to SNOW+?
settings.text: Yes, it is recommended to leave the top open or remove the bonnet for a while to allow your cats to feel at ease and become familiar with the new litter box.

settings.h3: How should I initially use SNOW+ during the transition period?
settings.text: During the first week, use SNOW+ as a regular open litter box without activating the cleaning cycle. Keep it in the same location as the previous litter box and maintain the surrounding items unchanged.

settings.h3: How can I help my cat become familiar with the new litter box scent?
settings.text: To help your cat become familiar with the scent of the new litter box, add all used cat litter from the previous litter box into SNOW+. This will assist in creating a familiar scent association.

settings.h3: Can I reduce the frequency of cleaning the old litter box during the transition period?
settings.text: Yes, reducing the frequency of cleaning the old litter box can make it less attractive to your cat and encourage them to start using SNOW+

settings.h3: When should I install back the bonnet on SNOW+?
settings.text: Once your cat starts using SNOW+ for the first time after a week, you can install back the bonnet. After two more days, begin the cleaning cycle and allow your cat to become accustomed to the sound. Power off the device again. Once it is frequently used, power it on again, switch to automatic cleaning mode, and remove the old litter box.

settings.h3: What should I do if my cat does not like the fan noise or scent after deodorization?
settings.text: If your cat does not like the fan noise, you can remove it for a few weeks. If they do not like the scent after deodorization, remove the fragrance box for a few weeks before trying again.

settings.h3: What can I do if my cat is reluctant to use SNOW+ without the top cover?
settings.text: If your cat is reluctant to use SNOW+ without the top cover, it may be due to their fear of the darkness inside. To address this, you can place the uncovered box in an area with more natural light to illuminate the interior. Another solution is to install small battery-powered LED lights inside the box, which has worked for some customers.

settings.h3: How do I properly power on the device?
settings.text: To power on the device, first, plug the small plug into the power input port on the base, then plug the AC/DC adapter into a nearby power outlet.

settings.h3: What is the self-test process during startup?
settings.text: During startup, the device will perform a self-test process to check the installation of each component. It will complete the self-check within three minutes. It is important not to touch the litter box during the self-check process to avoid interrupting the program.

settings.h3: What does the self-check process involve for each part?
settings.text:
Here are the self-check processes for each part:

1. Litter Box and Top Cover: The device detects the installation of the litter box and top cover. If there are any installation errors, it will report them in the SNOW+ APP and prompt you to check and install them correctly.

2. Globe: The motor operates to execute the globe self-check, testing the rotation and the ability to return to the initial position. The device will indicate the cleaning process in the app, and if the self-check is successful, it will report "Cleaning program normal."

3. Garbage Bag: The infrared sensor detects if the garbage bag is full and placed correctly. If conditions are normal, the device enters the ready state.

4. Cloud Indicator Light/Button Light: The cloud indicator light reflects the automatic cleaning
waiting time set by the user, while the button lights indicate the cleaning, emptying, and reset functions.

5. Bluetooth Network Indicator Light: The Bluetooth indicator light indicates the device's networking mode, such as being connected to the network or searching for a network.

settings.h3: What happens if there is an issue during the self-check process?
settings.text:
If any issues occur during the self-check process, such as installation
errors, interruptions, or abnormal self-check results, the device will report them in the SNOW+ APP and indicate the problem through the indicator lights.

settings.h3: What mode does the device enter after the self-check is complete?
settings.text: After the self-check is complete, the device enters standby mode, ready for normal operation.

settings.h3: Where can I find the networking instructions for the PetSnowy smart litter box?
settings.text: You can find detailed networking instructions in the installation instructions of the PetSnowy application. Please refer to the instructions specific to your device for accurate setup and networking guidance
